title: How to write a professional email to a client - Quora

response.answer_text: Say what you need to say in a professional way. Usually, a professional email starts with a polite greeting. Then, there's the body of the text. Again, this should be polite. It should be clear and, in general, slang, text speak and (in many cases) emojis should be avoided. (There are exceptions when, for example, you've worked with a client a long time and have a more relaxed way of communicating. Yet, you should always be careful not to be too casual.) Lastly, your conclusion might consist of a request for some action, a brief recap (if a longer email), a thank you and a salutation. An attractive, informative email signature would also add to your professional image.
